CLVM-483619 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		172.25.195.65	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 16:10 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483613 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.65	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 16:35 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-483510 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-Update03: Complete Update 3 Missing (KB2110231) 
1367 		172.25.195.163	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:53 	S1 (Urgent) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
The target is missing update ESXi550-Update03, which resolves the following security issues:
Bulletin ID <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2110247" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">ESXi550-201509101-SG</a>
Bulletin ID <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2116271" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">ESXi550-201509102-SG</a>
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2110231" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2110231</a> or <a href="http://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2015-0007.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2015-0007</a> for further details.	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 3029944 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2110231" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2110231</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://my.vmware.com/web/vmware/login" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2015-0007: VMware ESXi 5.5.0</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483505 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.53	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:34 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483495 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		172.21.209.26	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:08 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483491 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
1367 		172.25.192.127	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:45 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483485 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	172.25.195.208	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:54 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483484 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.72	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:51 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.

Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74

CLVM-483479 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		172.25.195.71	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 16:14 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483473 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	22 	172.25.195.247	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 16:00 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483467 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-201501001 Missing (KB2099265) 
1367 		172.25.195.163	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:53 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product.

Refer to VMware advisory <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2099265" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2099265</a> or <a href="http://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2015-0001.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2015-0001</a> for further details.	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 2352327 or the latest VMware ESXi build.

CLVM-483462 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	172.25.195.100	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 16:32 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-483424 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	172.25.195.74	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 13:59 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.

CLVM-483346 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.84	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:38 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483334 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG Missing (KB 2150882) 
1367 		172.25.195.163	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:53 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions on the guest system.
Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5.0	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267 or the latest VMware ESXi build.

CLVM-483329 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	2222 	172.25.192.148	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:24 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

EOL/Obsolete Operating System: VMware ESXi 5.5 Detected

CLVM-483288 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		172.21.208.165	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:12 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483281 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	172.21.209.26	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 15:08 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		172.21.62.139	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 11:31 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483224 
Writeable Root Directory on FTP Server 
2240 	21 	172.21.50.90	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:19 	S1 (Urgent) 	The FTP server has a world writeable root directory. The root directory of your FTP server can therefore be written-to by any user.	Disable write access for unauthorized users in the root directory of the FTP server.
For UNIX:
$ chmod o-w path/to/ftp/root/directory
For Microsoft IIS 6:
1. Click Start, point to Administrative Tools, and then click Internet Information Services (IIS).
2. In IIS Manager, expand the local computer, expand the FTP Sites folder, right-click the FTP site in question, and click Properties.
3. Click the Home Directory tab and deselect the Write checkbox; click OK.
4. For advanced permissions, refer to step 2 and click Permissions instead of Properties; then click Advanced Permissions.
For other versions of IIS, please refer to the Microsoft website.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483203 
EOL/Obsolete Software: OpenSSL 0.9.1 through 0.9.7 Detected 
2240 		172.21.208.133	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:40 	S1 (Urgent) 	An obsolete version of OpenSSL was detected on the host. No further releases or security fixes will be available for OpenSSL version 0.9.1 through 0.9.7.	Customers are advised to upgrade to the latest supported version of OpenSSL. Refer to <a href="https://www.openssl.org/source/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL Downloads</a> for more details.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483200 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	172.21.67.150	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 10:17 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483193 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
2240 	22 	172.21.197.2	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 10:08 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483192 
Microsoft Windows HTTP.sys Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS15-034) 
2240 		172.21.208.16	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:18 	S1 (Urgent) 	Windows is prone to a remote code execution affecting the HTTP protocol stack (HTTP.sys).
The vulnerability is caused when the HTTP protocol stack (HTTP.sys) improperly parses crafted HTTP requests.
Microsoft has released a security update that addresses the vulnerability by correcting the way that HTTP.sys handles requests. 
This security update is rated Critical for supported editions of Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 2008 R2 and Windows Server 2012.	Refer to <a href="https://technet.microsoft.com/library/security/MS15-034" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS15-034</a> for further information.
Patch:

CLVM-483189 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	172.21.67.208	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 13:16 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-483141 
OpenSSL Memory Leak Vulnerability (Heartbleed Bug) 
2240 	25 	172.21.58.195	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:31 	S1 (Urgent) 	OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) protocols as well as a full-strength general purpose cryptography library. For more details about the detection please refer to the Qualys community article <a href="https://community.qualys.com/blogs/qualys-tech/2014/04/09/heartbleed-detection-update" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">heartbleed-detection-update</a>.
OpenSSL is exposed to a security vulnerability due to a missing bounds check in the handling of the TLS heartbeat extension.
Affected Versions:
OpenSSL 1.0.1f, 1.0.1e, 1.0.1d, 1.0.1c, 1.0.1b, 1.0.1a, 1.0.1
PLEASE NOTE:
This QID will be reported as possible vulnerability (YELLOW) if it was triggered because the target host has a vulnerable OpenSSL banner.
This QID will be reports as confirmed vulnerability (RED) if the target responds to the SSL heartbeat request in a vulnerable fashion (irrespective of the OpenSSL banner).	Update to Version 1.0.1g to resolve this issue. The latest version is available for download from<a href="http://www.openssl.org/source/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL Web site</a>.
Workaround:
	Recompile OpenSSL with the handshake removed from the code by compile time option -DOPENSSL_NO_HEARTBEATS. 
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.0.1g.tar.gz" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL 1.0.1g</a>
Virtual Patches:
<a href="http://www.trendmicro.com/vulnerabilitycontrols" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Trend Micro Virtual Patching</a>
Virtual Patch #1006012: 1006012 - Identified Suspicious OpenSSL TLS/DTLS Heartbeat Request	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)

If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>

Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-483108 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	172.21.208.74	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:22 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

VMware ESXi 6.5 Patch Release ESXi650-201710401-BG Missing (KB 2151081)

CLVM-483080 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	172.21.60.117	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:48 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483078 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
2240 		172.21.67.163	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:13 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.

<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

2240 	22 	172.21.63.131	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 10:58 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.

Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library.

CLVM-483031 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
2240 	22 	172.21.60.153	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:11 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-483016 
EOL/Obsolete Operating System: VMware ESXi 5.5 Detected 
2240 		172.21.208.226	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:34 	S1 (Urgent) 	VMware ESXi 5.5 has been detected on the host.

CLVM-483013 
OpenSSL Memory Leak Vulnerability (Heartbleed Bug) 
2240 	443 	172.21.209.27	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:09 	S1 (Urgent) 	OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) protocols as well as a full-strength general purpose cryptography library. For more details about the detection please refer to the Qualys community article <a href="https://community.qualys.com/blogs/qualys-tech/2014/04/09/heartbleed-detection-update" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">heartbleed-detection-update</a>.
OpenSSL is exposed to a security vulnerability due to a missing bounds check in the handling of the TLS heartbeat extension.
Affected Versions:
OpenSSL 1.0.1f, 1.0.1e, 1.0.1d, 1.0.1c, 1.0.1b, 1.0.1a, 1.0.1
PLEASE NOTE:
This QID will be reported as possible vulnerability (YELLOW) if it was triggered because the target host has a vulnerable OpenSSL banner.
This QID will be reports as confirmed vulnerability (RED) if the target responds to the SSL heartbeat request in a vulnerable fashion (irrespective of the OpenSSL banner).	Update to Version 1.0.1g to resolve this issue. The latest version is available for download from<a href="http://www.openssl.org/source/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL Web site</a>.
Workaround:
	Recompile OpenSSL with the handshake removed from the code by compile time option -DOPENSSL_NO_HEARTBEATS. 
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.0.1g.tar.gz" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL 1.0.1g</a>
Virtual Patches:
<a href="http://www.trendmicro.com/vulnerabilitycontrols" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Trend Micro Virtual Patching</a>
Virtual Patch #1006012: 1006012 - Identified Suspicious OpenSSL TLS/DTLS Heartbeat Request	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	172.21.208.2	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:07 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482999 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	172.21.209.135	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:08 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482983 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-201501001 Missing (KB2099265)

The target is missing update ESXi550-201501001, which resolves the following security issue:
Bulletin ID <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2099273" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">ESXi550-201501101-SG</a>
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2099265" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2099265</a> or <a href="http://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2015-0001.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2015-0001</a> for further details. CLVM-482969 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		172.21.56.82	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 10:19 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482952 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.61	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 13:58 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482950

CLVM-482946 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
2240 		172.21.60.230	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 10:50 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-482935 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.149	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:50 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482930 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		172.21.56.85	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:56 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>

CLVM-482924 
Null Authentication VNC Server Access 
2240 	5901 	172.21.67.44	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 12:03 	S1 (Urgent) 	VNC (Virtual Network Computing) is similar to Xwindows in that it is a remote, graphical interface. It is freely available from multiple vendors (for example AT&T Cambridge).
To create a session with VNC server, a primitive sort of authentication is implemented. There is an option to not use authentication at all, in which case anyone is allowed to connect to the VNC server.
An example of such default configuration is ClumpOS.
ClumpOS is a CD-based Linux and Mosix distribution that is maintained and distributed by the Mosix project. ClumpOS does not prompt a user to set a password for VNC when installed. Instead, ClumpOS leaves the default password for VNC blank, which allows remote root access to the system.	As a possible workaround, manually set a VNC password or remove the VNC server (if not needed).	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482898 
EOL/Obsolete Operating System: VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMware ESXi 5.1 Detected 
2240 		172.21.208.150	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:10 	S1 (Urgent) 	VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMware ESX 5.1 has been detected on the host. 
Support for VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMWare ESX 5.1 ended on August 24, 2018.
QID Detection Logic (unauthenticated):
This QID reviews OS information from VMware API SOAP request.	Update to a supported version of ESXi. Refer to <a href="https://www.vmware.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMware</a> for information on obtaining the latest version.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482895 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	172.21.67.220	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 10:59 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.

Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	172.21.61.198	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 13:01 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482836 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	172.21.209.27	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:09 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-482822 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		172.21.209.28	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:12 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-482797 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
2240 	22 	172.21.208.67	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:45 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-482770 
Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS12-020) 
2240 		172.21.209.33	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:32 	S1 (Urgent) 	The Remote Desktop feature in Windows enables access to all of the programs, resources and accessories on a user's computer from a second Windows-based computer.
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted (CVE-2012-0002).
A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol service processes packets. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the target service to stop responding (CVE-2012-0152).
This security update is rated Critical for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.
Note:
NLA or network layer authentication is a layer of security on top of RDP. If NLA is enabled then the vulnerability can be exploited remotely but will need credentials.
1. The authenticated check will determine presence of this vulnerability irrespective of the NLA setting.
2. The remote check can determine presence of this vulnerability only if NLA is disabled.
We encourage customers to patch irrespective of the NLA status.
Windows Embedded Systems:- For additional information regarding security updates for embedded systems, refer to the following MSDN blog(s):
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/03/26/march-2012-security-updates-for-xpe-sp3-and-standard-2009-are-now-on-ece.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">March 2012 Security Updates for XPe SP3 and Standard 2009 Are Now on ECE</a> (KB2621440)
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/04/24/april-2012-security-updates-are-live-on-ece-for-xpe-and-standard-2009.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">April 2012 Security Updates are Live on ECE for XPe and Standard 2009</a> (KB2621440)
Note: This vulnerability is applicable to versions of the software that are not listed in the official advisory.	Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=18a1fe48-1318-4b93-afad-206950bb1ae5" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Service Pack 3</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=eccf865d-399a-4862-b26f-f35580419875" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=b69b4b9b-c0a1-4c1e-b081-8529eaf1536a" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=8081e67f-288c-4714-bff8-e0ff9777692f" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=521baa02-5d7a-4cba-8a1a-2af1b6e4cbe4" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=39abdf7b-ea9d-4b95-a28d-4140374d531d" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Vista Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=e5970daf-4440-42fa-8efc-e6190c6a22aa" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Vista x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=fef2c1d7-2004-43d7-aa49-673c6f374670" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2008 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=4ffae13f-3432-4849-a2da-a76f96d7ceb3" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2008 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=67581250-50fd-4f4c-a3cc-45ce2662b0c3" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2008 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=16b0195c-84d3-4c08-8b98-ff2c80d144e1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems and Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=3a6c7fdf-105a-4886-ad52-c892f37e32d1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems and Windows 7 for 32-bit Systems Service Pack 1</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=40b62d08-d2a2-4900-b01c-46fc761973d0" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows 7 for x64-based Systems and Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=1bbe7cda-4bee-4d65-8127-3c13624a1168" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows 7 for x64-based Systems and Windows 7 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=7c1774cc-e00c-47f3-97a2-bc90de857793" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems and Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1*</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=7ec21f41-1673-4592-b45c-6438ad57e08c" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems and Windows Server 2008 R2 for x64-based Systems Service Pack 1*</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=6a07f99c-8ab4-4e44-8d48-6ac787dd2b51" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems and Windows Server 2008 R2 for Itanium-based Systems Service Pack 1</a>

Bulletin ID <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2041637" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">ESXi510-201304101-SG</a>

<a href="http://www.vmware.com/patchmgr/download.portal" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2041632: VMware ESXi 5.1.0 </a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-482763 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.133	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:56 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-482744 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	172.21.209.197	2019.Feb.16 	2019.Feb.21 14:54 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com
