CLVM-460060 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	10.22.168.83	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 16:12 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.

Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities

Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.

Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. CLVM-460058 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		10.29.198.190	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 21:27 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-460057 
VMware ESXi 6.5 Patch Release ESXi650-201712103-SG,ESXi650-201712101-SG Missing (KB 2151102)(Spectre) 
2240 		10.29.198.67	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 17:14 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS) (CVE-2017-4940)
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.)(CVE-2017-5753, CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 6.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 7273056 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2151102" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2151102</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 6.5</a>
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2018-0002.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2018-0002: VMware ESXi 6.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>

CLVM-460055 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	10.29.207.80	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 19:48 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-460046 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	10.29.199.8	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 16:37 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-460044 
EOL/Obsolete Operating System: VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMware ESXi 5.1 Detected 
2240 		10.29.197.18	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 17:56 	S1 (Urgent) 	VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMware ESX 5.1 has been detected on the host. 
Support for VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMWare ESX 5.1 ended on August 24, 2018.
QID Detection Logic (unauthenticated):
This QID reviews OS information from VMware API SOAP request.	Update to a supported version of ESXi. Refer to <a href="https://www.vmware.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMware</a> for information on obtaining the latest version.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-460028 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
2240 	22 	10.29.202.11	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 15:32 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-459994 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	10.29.204.2	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 20:54 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.

CLVM-459964 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
2240 	22 	10.29.204.2	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 20:54 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-459939 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
2240 		10.29.202.7	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 15:32 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-459833 
VMware ESXi 6.5 Patch Release ESXi650-201712103-SG,ESXi650-201712101-SG Missing (KB 2151102)(Spectre) 
2240 		10.29.204.9	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 21:24 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS) (CVE-2017-4940)
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.)(CVE-2017-5753, CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 6.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 7273056 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2151102" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2151102</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 6.5</a>
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2018-0002.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2018-0002: VMware ESXi 6.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-459781 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	10.29.198.229	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 16:20 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-459726 
Dropbear SSH Multiple Security Vulnerabilities 
1367 	22 	10.22.175.25	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 21:00 	S1 (Urgent) 	Dropbear is a software package that provides a Secure Shell-compatible server and client. It is designed as a replacement for standard OpenSSH for environments with low memory and processor resources, such as embedded systems.
Dropbear SSH contains the following vulnerabilites:
CVE-2016-7406: Format string vulnerability in Dropbear SSH allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via format string specifiers in the (1) username or (2) host argument.
CVE-2016-7407: The dropbearconvert command in Dropbear SSH allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted OpenSSH key file.
CVE-2016-7408: dbclient could run arbitrary code as the local dbclient user if particular -m or -c arguments are provided. This could be an issue where dbclient is used in scripts. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code within the context of an application using the affected library. 
CVE-2016-7409: The dbclient and server in Dropbear SSH before 2016.74, when compiled with DEBUG_TRACE, allows local users to read process memory via the -v argument, related to a failed remote ident. Dropbear SSH is prone to a remote information disclosure vulnerability. Successfully exploiting this issue will allow the attacker to gain sensitive information.
Affected Versions:
Dropbear SSH prior to 2016.74
QID Detection Logic (Authenticated):
This authenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of the Dropbear SSH client by running the "dropbear -V" command.
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
This unauthenticated detection matches vulnerable versions of Dropbear SSH based on the banner disclosed by the remote service.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74</a> or later versions to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://matt.ucc.asn.au/dropbear/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Dropbear SSH 2016.74 or later</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-459720 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
2240 	22 	10.29.202.12	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 19:26 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-459689 
IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication Remote Password Hash Retrieval Vulnerability 
1367 		10.22.175.143	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 19:58 	S2 (High) 	The IPMI 2.0 specification supports RMCP+ Authenticated Key-Exchange Protocol (RAKP) authentication, which allows remote attackers to obtain password hashes and conduct offline password guessing attacks by obtaining the HMAC from a RAKP message 2 response from a BMC.
Note: The IPMI 2.0 RAKP Authentication will be performed for the following users names: ADMIN, admin, root, Administrator, USERID.	IBM has made available a fix for CVE-2013-4037 at the following location: <a href="http://www-947.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/docdisplay?lndocid=MIGR-5093463" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MIGR-5093463</a>
Workaround:
Ensure that no IPMI enabled devices are exposed to untrusted networks.
Set complex passwords.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-459599 
VMware ESXi 6.5 Patch Release ESXi650-201710401-BG Missing (KB 2151081) 
2240 		10.29.204.9	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 21:24 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a heap overflow via a specific set of VNC packets resulting in heap corruption. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session (CVE-2017-4933)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 6.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6765664 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2151081?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2151081</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 6.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-459552 
OpenSSL Memory Leak Vulnerability (Heartbleed Bug) 
1367 	443 	10.22.175.25	2019.Jan.31 	2019.Feb.21 21:00 	S1 (Urgent) 	OpenSSL is a toolkit that implements the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) protocols as well as a full-strength general purpose cryptography library. For more details about the detection please refer to the Qualys community article <a href="https://community.qualys.com/blogs/qualys-tech/2014/04/09/heartbleed-detection-update" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">heartbleed-detection-update</a>.
OpenSSL is exposed to a security vulnerability due to a missing bounds check in the handling of the TLS heartbeat extension.
Affected Versions:
OpenSSL 1.0.1f, 1.0.1e, 1.0.1d, 1.0.1c, 1.0.1b, 1.0.1a, 1.0.1
PLEASE NOTE:
This QID will be reported as possible vulnerability (YELLOW) if it was triggered because the target host has a vulnerable OpenSSL banner.
This QID will be reports as confirmed vulnerability (RED) if the target responds to the SSL heartbeat request in a vulnerable fashion (irrespective of the OpenSSL banner).	Update to Version 1.0.1g to resolve this issue. The latest version is available for download from<a href="http://www.openssl.org/source/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL Web site</a>.
Workaround:
	Recompile OpenSSL with the handshake removed from the code by compile time option -DOPENSSL_NO_HEARTBEATS. 
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.openssl.org/source/openssl-1.0.1g.tar.gz" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL 1.0.1g</a>
Virtual Patches:
<a href="http://www.trendmicro.com/vulnerabilitycontrols" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Trend Micro Virtual Patching</a>
Virtual Patch #1006012: 1006012 - Identified Suspicious OpenSSL TLS/DTLS Heartbeat Request	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

EOL/Obsolete Operating System: VMware ESXi 5.0 / VMware ESXi 5.1 Detected

CLVM-459300 
VMware ESXi 5.0.0 Patch Release ESXi500-201510001 Missing (KB2113684)

CLVM-455930 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	22 	172.25.195.117	2019.Jan.29 	2019.Feb.16 01:43 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-450997 
Jenkins Multiple Security Vulnerabilities (Jenkins Security Advisory 2018-12-05) 
1367 	8080 	172.25.195.144	2019.Jan.27 	2019.Feb.21 17:31 	S2 (High) 	Jenkins is an open source automation server written in Java. Jenkins helps to automate the non-human part of the software development process, with continuous integration and facilitating technical aspects of continuous delivery.
Following vulnerabilities are reported in Jenkins:
	Code execution through crafted URLs 
	Forced migration of user records 
	Workspace browser allowed accessing files outside the workspace 
	Potential denial of service through cron expression form validation 
Affected Versions:
Jenkins weekly up to and including 2.153
Jenkins LTS up to and including 2.138.3
QID Detection Logic:(Unauthenticated)
This QID checks for vulnerable version by sending a crafted GET request to Jenkins. This QID also detects the vulnerable version from login page or HTTP header.	Customers are advised to upgrade to <a href="https://jenkins.io/download/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> Jenkins weekly version 2.154,Jenkins LTS version 2.138.4 or 2.150.1</a> or later to remediate these vulnerabilities.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2018-12-05/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Jenkins Security Advisory 2018-12-05</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-443942 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		172.25.195.161	2019.Jan.20 	2019.Feb.21 16:25 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-443552 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	2222 	172.25.195.105	2019.Jan.19 	2019.Feb.21 14:46 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-443518 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	172.25.192.99	2019.Jan.19 	2019.Feb.21 15:38 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:

an unauthorized session key recovery problem

Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>

CLVM-421631 
Apache Struts Jakarta Multipart parser Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (S2-045) 
2240 	443 	10.29.202.43	2019.Jan.18 	2019.Feb.21 18:57 	S1 (Urgent) 	Apache Struts is a framework for building web applications. A vulnerability exists due to improper handling of requests with a malicious Content-Type value. If the Content-Type value isn't valid an exception is thrown which is then used to display an error message to a user.
Affected software:
Apache Struts 2.3.5 to 2.3.31
Apache Struts 2.5 to 2.5.10
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
The QID has two type of signatures. In the first type the scanner send a custom Content-Type header to check for command execution to the .action, .go,.do and other common files. In the second type the scanner asks the target to perform an arithmetic operation via the Content-Type header to check for command execution. Since this is an active check the scanner should be able to invoke the vulnerable struts configuration for the check to work.
Please note:
1) If there is an authentication scheme configured for the server, then VM scanner will not be able to detect this QID. In such cases we recommend using the WAS QID 150173 as WAS has support for authentication as well as in-dept crawling. Please refer to the Qualys Apache Struts blog:
<a href="https://blog.qualys.com/securitylabs/2017/03/14/apache-struts-cve-2017-5638-vulnerability-and-the-qualys-solution" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">https://blog.qualys.com/securitylabs/2017/03/14/apache-struts-cve-2017-5638-vulnerability-and-the-qualys-solution</a>
2) The requests sent by the scanner should be able to invoke the vulnerable struts configuration. If the vulnerable behavior is triggered in a nested directory which the scanner cannot find then this QID will not be posted.
QID detection logic (Authenticated):
Detection looks for "struts core" jar files in deployed web applications directories and lib folder of Tomcat server. Once it successfully finds the jar file, version information is extracted from that jar files and compared.
Please note: Our detection does not support if the applications are deployed with server configuration unpackWARs=false.	The vendor has released advisories and updates to fix these vulnerabilities. Refer to the following link for further details:
<a href="https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/Version+Notes+2.3.32" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Apache Struts 2.3.32</a>
<a href="https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/Version+Notes+2.5.10.1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Apache Struts 2.5.10.1</a>
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-045" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">S2-045</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420989 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.49.76	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 05:55 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420987 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		10.22.50.37	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 05:18 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420973 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.50.82	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 04:10 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420799 
Apache Tomcat JK Web Server Connector Path Traversal Information Disclosure Vulnerability 
1367 	443 	10.22.50.141	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 00:40 	S2 (High) 	The Apache Web Server (httpd) specific code that normalised the requested path before matching it to the URI-worker map in Apache Tomcat JK (mod_jk) Connector did not handle some edge cases correctly.
If only a sub-set of the URLs supported by Tomcat were exposed via httpd, then it was possible for a specially constructed request to expose application functionality through the reverse proxy that was not intended for clients accessing the application via the reverse proxy.
It was also possible in some configurations for a specially constructed request to bypass the access controls configured in httpd.
It is vulnerable only if jkstatus is present with specific configurations in the server.
Affected Versions:
Apache Tomcat JK (mod_jk) Connector 1.2.0 to 1.2.44
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
It sends a GET request to serverIP/jkstatus; to check if target is vulnerable.	The vendor has advised to upgrade to Apache Tomcat JK ISAPI Connector to version 1.2.46 or later, which is available for download from <a href="https://tomcat.apache.org/download-connectors.cgi" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Apache Tomcat jk connector</a> Web site.
Workaround:
The vendor has advised to use alternative measures (e.g. the remote address filter) to restrict access to trusted users.
For more information please visit <a href="https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/6d564bb0ab73d6b3efdd1d6b1c075d1a2c84ecd84a4159d6122529ad@%3Cannounce.tomcat.apache.org%3E" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">here</a>.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://tomcat.apache.org/security-jk.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Apache Tomcat JK</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420773 
Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS12-020) 
1367 		10.22.49.175	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 04:41 	S1 (Urgent) 	The Remote Desktop feature in Windows enables access to all of the programs, resources and accessories on a user's computer from a second Windows-based computer.
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted (CVE-2012-0002).
A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol service processes packets. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the target service to stop responding (CVE-2012-0152).
This security update is rated Critical for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.
Note:
NLA or network layer authentication is a layer of security on top of RDP. If NLA is enabled then the vulnerability can be exploited remotely but will need credentials.
1. The authenticated check will determine presence of this vulnerability irrespective of the NLA setting.
2. The remote check can determine presence of this vulnerability only if NLA is disabled.
We encourage customers to patch irrespective of the NLA status.
Windows Embedded Systems:- For additional information regarding security updates for embedded systems, refer to the following MSDN blog(s):
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/03/26/march-2012-security-updates-for-xpe-sp3-and-standard-2009-are-now-on-ece.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">March 2012 Security Updates for XPe SP3 and Standard 2009 Are Now on ECE</a> (KB2621440)
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/04/24/april-2012-security-updates-are-live-on-ece-for-xpe-and-standard-2009.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">April 2012 Security Updates are Live on ECE for XPe and Standard 2009</a> (KB2621440)
Note: This vulnerability is applicable to versions of the software that are not listed in the official advisory.	Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=18a1fe48-1318-4b93-afad-206950bb1ae5" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Service Pack 3</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=eccf865d-399a-4862-b26f-f35580419875" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=b69b4b9b-c0a1-4c1e-b081-8529eaf1536a" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=8081e67f-288c-4714-bff8-e0ff9777692f" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=521baa02-5d7a-4cba-8a1a-2af1b6e4cbe4" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=39abdf7b-ea9d-4b95-a28d-4140374d531d" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Vista Service Pack 2</a>

CLVM-420764 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG Missing (KB 2150882) 
1367 		10.22.50.40	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 01:24 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions on the guest system.
Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5.0	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2150876" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0015.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0015: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420715 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		10.22.50.34	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 12:52 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420702 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	22 	10.22.50.101	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.27 23:42 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420698 
EOL/Obsolete Operating System: VMware ESXi 5.5 Detected 
1367 		10.22.50.36	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 09:51 	S1 (Urgent) 	VMware ESXi 5.5 has been detected on the host. 
Support for VMware ESXi 5.5 ended on September 19, 2018.
QID Detection Logic (unauthenticated):
This QID reviews OS information from VMware API SOAP request.	Update to a supported version of ESXi. Refer to <a href="https://www.vmware.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMware</a> for information on obtaining the latest version.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420613 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.50.42	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 03:40 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420611 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.50.77	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.21 22:07 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing.

If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>

NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420610 
Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS12-020) 
1367 		10.22.49.140	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Jan.31 17:14 	S1 (Urgent) 	The Remote Desktop feature in Windows enables access to all of the programs, resources and accessories on a user's computer from a second Windows-based computer.
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted (CVE-2012-0002).
A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol service processes packets. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the target service to stop responding (CVE-2012-0152).
This security update is rated Critical for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.
Note:
NLA or network layer authentication is a layer of security on top of RDP. If NLA is enabled then the vulnerability can be exploited remotely but will need credentials.
1. The authenticated check will determine presence of this vulnerability irrespective of the NLA setting.
2. The remote check can determine presence of this vulnerability only if NLA is disabled.
We encourage customers to patch irrespective of the NLA status.
Windows Embedded Systems:- For additional information regarding security updates for embedded systems, refer to the following MSDN blog(s):
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/03/26/march-2012-security-updates-for-xpe-sp3-and-standard-2009-are-now-on-ece.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">March 2012 Security Updates for XPe SP3 and Standard 2009 Are Now on ECE</a> (KB2621440)
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/04/24/april-2012-security-updates-are-live-on-ece-for-xpe-and-standard-2009.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">April 2012 Security Updates are Live on ECE for XPe and Standard 2009</a> (KB2621440)
Note: This vulnerability is applicable to versions of the software that are not listed in the official advisory.	Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=18a1fe48-1318-4b93-afad-206950bb1ae5" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Service Pack 3</a>

<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=8081e67f-288c-4714-bff8-e0ff9777692f" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>

CLVM-420607 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-201501001 Missing (KB2099265) 
1367 		10.22.50.31	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 05:43 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
The target is missing update ESXi550-201501001, which resolves the following security issue:
Bulletin ID <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2099273" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">ESXi550-201501101-SG</a>
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2099265" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2099265</a> or <a href="http://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2015-0001.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2015-0001</a> for further details.	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 2352327 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="http://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2099265" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB2099265</a> for updates and build information.

CLVM-420524 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		10.22.50.45	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.21 20:08 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420514 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.50.83	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 02:15 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420497 
SSH Protocol Version 1 Supported 
1367 	2222 	10.22.50.101	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.27 23:42 	S2 (High) 	SSH1 protocol was deprecated due to multiple vulnerabilities and design flaws.
Among multiple vulnerabilities that exist in SSH protocol Version 1 are:
a CRC32 compensation attack detector vulnerability (buffer overflow)
an unauthorized session key recovery problem
Multiple vendors' implementations are vulnerable due to the fact that these are protocol design errors. Version 2 of the SSH protocol fixed these errors.
Please refer to the following URL for more information:
<a href="http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/684820</a>	Disable SSH1 support. See your vendor's Web site for information on how to disable SSH protocol Version 1 support. Some references are provided below:
<a href="http://www.ssh.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">SSH Communications Security</a>
<a href="http://www.f-secure.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">F-Secure</a>
<a href="http://www.openssh.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">OpenSSH</a>
Note: Do not enable SSH Version 1 Fallback since systems with upgraded versions of SSH and with Fallback Version 1 enabled are still vulnerable.	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420474 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.50.78	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 08:34 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420436 
Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS12-020) 
1367 		10.22.49.150	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 10:25 	S1 (Urgent) 	The Remote Desktop feature in Windows enables access to all of the programs, resources and accessories on a user's computer from a second Windows-based computer.
A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted (CVE-2012-0002).
A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way the Remote Desktop Protocol service processes packets. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the target service to stop responding (CVE-2012-0152).
This security update is rated Critical for all supported releases of Microsoft Windows.
Note:
NLA or network layer authentication is a layer of security on top of RDP. If NLA is enabled then the vulnerability can be exploited remotely but will need credentials.
1. The authenticated check will determine presence of this vulnerability irrespective of the NLA setting.
2. The remote check can determine presence of this vulnerability only if NLA is disabled.
We encourage customers to patch irrespective of the NLA status.
Windows Embedded Systems:- For additional information regarding security updates for embedded systems, refer to the following MSDN blog(s):
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/03/26/march-2012-security-updates-for-xpe-sp3-and-standard-2009-are-now-on-ece.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">March 2012 Security Updates for XPe SP3 and Standard 2009 Are Now on ECE</a> (KB2621440)
<a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/embedded/archive/2012/04/24/april-2012-security-updates-are-live-on-ece-for-xpe-and-standard-2009.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">April 2012 Security Updates are Live on ECE for XPe and Standard 2009</a> (KB2621440)
Note: This vulnerability is applicable to versions of the software that are not listed in the official advisory.	Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=18a1fe48-1318-4b93-afad-206950bb1ae5" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Service Pack 3</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=eccf865d-399a-4862-b26f-f35580419875" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows XP Professional x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=b69b4b9b-c0a1-4c1e-b081-8529eaf1536a" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=8081e67f-288c-4714-bff8-e0ff9777692f" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 x64 Edition Service Pack 2</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=521baa02-5d7a-4cba-8a1a-2af1b6e4cbe4" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Server 2003 with SP2 for Itanium-based Systems</a>
<a href="http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=39abdf7b-ea9d-4b95-a28d-4140374d531d" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MS12-020: Windows Vista Service Pack 2</a>

CLVM-420434 
VMware ESXi 5.5.0 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG Missing (KB 2150882) 
1367 		10.22.50.45	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.21 20:08 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions on the guest system.
Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5.0	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267 or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/selfservice/microsites/search.do?language=en_US&cmd=displayKC&externalId=2150876" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0015.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0015: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420421 
VMware ESXi 5.5 Patch Release ESXi550-201709101-SG, ESXi550-201709102-SG Missing (KB 2150882)(Spectre) 
1367 		10.22.50.40	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 01:24 	S2 (High) 	VMware ESXi is an enterprise level computer virtualization product. 
A vulnerability was reported in VMware ESXi. The ESXi Host Client contains a vulnerability that may allow for stored cross-site scripting (XSS).
Exploiting the vulnerability could allow an authenticated VNC session to cause a stack overflow via a specific set of VNC packets. Successful exploitation of this issue could result in remote code execution in a virtual machine via the authenticated VNC session.
CPU data cache timing can be abused to efficiently leak information out of mis-speculated CPU execution, leading to (at worst) arbitrary virtual memory read vulnerabilities across local security boundaries in various contexts. (Speculative execution is an automatic and inherent CPU performance optimization used in all modern processors.) (CVE-2017-5715)
QID Detection Logic(authenticated):
This QID checks for vulnerable versions of VMware ESXi 5.5	To resolve this issue, upgrade to VMware ESXi Build 6480267or the latest VMware ESXi build. 
Refer to VMware advisory <a href="https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2150882?r=2&Quarterback.validateRoute=1&KM_Utility.getArticleData=1&KM_Utility.getGUser=1&KM_Utility.getArticleLanguage=1&KM_Utility.getArticle=1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">KB 2150882</a> for updates and build information.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2017-0021.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">VMSA-2017-0021: VMware ESXi 5.5</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420413 
SSH User Login Bruteforced 
1367 	22 	10.22.49.93	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 05:06 	S1 (Urgent) 	One or more valid SSH user logins have been found through bruteforcing. 
An account on a router, firewall, or other network device has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0508)
A Unix account has a default, null, blank, or missing password.(CVE-1999-0502)
Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20 allows remote attackers to obtain administrative access by entering an unspecified password during a (1) SSH or (2) TELNET session.(CVE-2015-7755)
Affected Versions
This issue only affects ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20. No other Juniper products or versions of ScreenOS are affected by this issue.	Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.<P>
If the host is running Juniper ScreenOS 6.3.0r17 through 6.3.0r20, there are updates available from Juniper for <A HREF="https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10713" TARGET="_blank">CVE-2015-7755</A>. <P>
Workaround:<BR>
Restricting management access to only trusted management networks and hosts will help mitigate this issue. The attack can only be executed from a location where a legitimate management login would be permitted.
NOTE THAT THIS SOLUTION IS NOT SUGGESTING THAT YOU’RE RUNNING JUNOS, IT IS MERELY PROVIDING GUIDANCE ON WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE RUNNING JUNOS.
Change the user passwords so that they are difficult to guess.
Eg.. Strong passwords should (at a minimum) meet the following requirements:
	Contain at least eight alphanumeric characters. 
	Contain both upper and lower case letters. 
	Contain at least one number (for example, 0-9). 
	Contain at least one special character. 	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com 
CLVM-420387 
Oracle Database TNS Listener Poison Attack Vulnerability 
1367 	1521 	10.22.50.83	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 02:15 	S2 (High) 	A vulnerability exists in the Listener component of Oracle Database Server. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows successful unauthenticated network attacks via Oracle Net. Successful attack of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to all Listener accessible data as well as read access to all Listener accessible data and ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of Listener.
This vulnerability allows an attacker to perform a man-in-the-middle attack by registering an additional database instance in the TNS listener. The listener will then start load-balancing traffic to the new instance. This allows the attacker to receive the database transactions, record them and forward them to the original database. The attacker could also potentially modify the transactions and execute commands on the original database server. 
This QID sends a request to register with the listener with the following command:
(CONNECT_DATA=(COMMAND=service_register_NSGR))
If the listener acknowledges and allows the scanner to register, then the QID is posted. If Oracle suggested solution is applied then the listener should not allow the scanner to register successfully.
Affected Products and Versions:
Oracle Database 11g Release 2, versions 11.2.0.2, 11.2.0.3, 11.2.0.4
Oracle Database 11g Release 1, version 11.1.0.7
Oracle Database 10g Release 2, versions 10.2.0.3, 10.2.0.4, 10.2.0.5
NOTE: Although Oracle Database prior to 10g versions are not listed in the Oracle advisory, older versions of Oracle not covered by their lifetime policy and as per advisory, they could be affected.	There are no vendor supplied patches available at this time, however; Oracle has released workarounds to resolve the issue.
Production Oracle database installations typically do not expose their TNS listener to the Internet or even the enterprise network.
Workaround:
Oracle has released a workaround to resolve this issue. Refer to <a href="http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/alert-cve-2012-1675-1608180.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Oracle CVE-2012-1675 Alert</a> to obtain more information.
Virtual Patches:
<a href="http://www.trendmicro.com/vulnerabilitycontrols" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Trend Micro Virtual Patching</a>
Virtual Patch #1004997: 1004997 - Detected Too Many Oracle TNS Service Register Requests	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com

CLVM-420333 
Apache Tomcat JK Web Server Connector Path Traversal Information Disclosure Vulnerability 
1367 	80 	10.22.50.141	2019.Jan.17 	2019.Feb.28 00:40 	S2 (High) 	The Apache Web Server (httpd) specific code that normalised the requested path before matching it to the URI-worker map in Apache Tomcat JK (mod_jk) Connector did not handle some edge cases correctly.
If only a sub-set of the URLs supported by Tomcat were exposed via httpd, then it was possible for a specially constructed request to expose application functionality through the reverse proxy that was not intended for clients accessing the application via the reverse proxy.
It was also possible in some configurations for a specially constructed request to bypass the access controls configured in httpd.
It is vulnerable only if jkstatus is present with specific configurations in the server.
Affected Versions:
Apache Tomcat JK (mod_jk) Connector 1.2.0 to 1.2.44
QID Detection Logic (Unauthenticated):
It sends a GET request to serverIP/jkstatus; to check if target is vulnerable.	The vendor has advised to upgrade to Apache Tomcat JK ISAPI Connector to version 1.2.46 or later, which is available for download from <a href="https://tomcat.apache.org/download-connectors.cgi" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Apache Tomcat jk connector</a> Web site.
Workaround:
The vendor has advised to use alternative measures (e.g. the remote address filter) to restrict access to trusted users.
For more information please visit <a href="https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/6d564bb0ab73d6b3efdd1d6b1c075d1a2c84ecd84a4159d6122529ad@%3Cannounce.tomcat.apache.org%3E" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">here</a>.
Patch:
Following are links for downloading patches to fix the vulnerabilities:
<a href="http://tomcat.apache.org/security-jk.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Apache Tomcat JK</a>	rcanda@cisco.com 	tleese@cisco.com
